clinical_study.brief_title: Nintedanib as Switch Maintenance Treatment of Pleural Malignant Mesothelioma
clinical_study.official_title: Nintedanib as Maintenance Treatment of Pleural Malignant Mesothelioma (NEMO): a Randomized Double Blinded Phase II Study of the EORTC Lung Cancer Group

lead_sponsor.agency: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - EORTC

clinical_study.source: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - EORTC

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, 1:1, double blinded phase II trial. Patients with unresectable malignant pleural mesothelioma (MPM) will be randomized between arm A: nintedanib and arm B:placebo

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multicenter, prospective, double blinded, randomized, two-arm phase II trial aiming to evaluate nintedanib treatment as switch maintenance in patients with unresectable MPM.
After signing of the informed consent and upon confirmation of all eligibility criteria, patients will be randomized 1:1 to:
- Arm A: twice daily nintedanib at a dose of 200 mg until progression or unacceptable toxicities.
- Arm B: matched placebo.
Response evaluation will be performed through CT scans every 8 weeks.

primary_outcome.description: From randomization until progression or death

secondary_outcome.description: From randomization until progression or death

arm_group.description: 200 mg twice a day per os
Placebo match twice a day per os
